bibl.title: Peter Nelson et al v. Lewis V Wycoff. Civil
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Nelson Peter, Smith W, Elsner H, Whaley C, Mattson G, Lundblad Charles, Coffrey Dennis & Annir Jacob

div1.p: To the Judge of the District Court of the 3d Judicial District of said Territory held at Seattle in and for the counties of King Kistap and Snohomish

Peter Nelson W Smith H Elsner C Whaley G Mattson Charles Lundblad Dennis Coffy & Jasob Annir late mariners on board the Bark Bern of the Osean a vessel of over fifty tons now lying farther at the port of Seattle in the District aforesaid, and within the admiralty and maritime jurisdiction of this honorable court, exhibit this their libel against the said vessel whereof S.P. Gray now is or lately was master, her tackle apparel and furniture and against all persons lawfully intervening for their interest therein in a cause of subtraction of wages said and maritime

And therefore the said Peter Nelson W Smith H Elsner C Whaly G Mattson Charles Lundblad Dennis Coffy and Jasob Annir, do allege
allege and artisulately propound as follows, to wit:

First that on or about the 8h day of April AD 1875 the said vessel whereof the said S.E.Gray was master, being then in the part of San Francisco and designed on a voyage upon the high seas and within the flux and re-flux thereof, and within the admiralty and maritime jurisdiction of this honorable court, to wit from the said Port of San Francisso in the State of California to the Port of Seattle in Washington Territory he the said S.P. Gray master as aforesaid did ship and hire them the said Peter Nelson W Smith H Elsner C Whaly G Mattson Charles Lundblad Dennis Coffy and Jasob Annier libellants aforesaid to serve as mariners on board said vessel for and during the said voyage at the highest rage of wages given at said port of San Francisco to wit the wages of forty five dollars per month each and accordingly
the libellants entered on board and into the servise of the said vessel in the capasity and at the monthly wages aforesaid on or about the said 8th day of April AD 1875 and the said vessel proseeded to sea with the said libellants on board without their signing any shipping artisle or agreement in writing or in print whatever

Sesond That the said vessel proseeded on her voyage with the libellants on board, and arrived at the Port of Seattle aforesaid on or about the 23d day of April AD 1875 and the said libellants were entitled to their dissarge and the wages aforesaid. but the said S.P. Gray Master as aforesaid refused to dissharge said libellants or pay them their said wages though often requested as to do, and the said S.P.Gry master as aforesaid combining and confederating with one JSSmith and Lewis V Wyshoff on or about the day of April AD 1875 forsibly took libellant off from the
said vessel and put them in the jail of said County of King where they still remain without having been in any way dissharged from said vessel.

Third That during all the aforesaid voyage and time the libellants and eash of them well and truly performed his duty on board the said vessel in the capasity aforesaid and was obedient to all the lawful commands of the said Master and other offisers on board the said vessel, and well and truly deserved the wages of forty five dollars per month as aforesaid
Fourth That all and singular the premises are true

Wherefore libellants pray that prosess in due form of law may issue against the said vessel her tackle apparel and furniture and that this honorable court will pronounce for the wages aforesaid and desred the sum to be fair with costs, and for sush other and further relif and redress as the right and justice may appertain and as the Court is competent to give in the premises
Peter Nelson W Smith H Elsner C Whaley G Mattson Charles Lundblad Dennis his X mark Coffey Jacob Annir
John J. Mc W.H. White prostors
